thread.title: SOTE students take to the stage for classic musical
thread.title_full: SOTE students take to the stage for classic musical

title: SOTE students take to the stage for classic musical
text:
SOTE students take to the stage for classic musical Paige Ashby | 14th Oct 2015 5:00 AM Paige Ashby SOTE students Kieran Power and Ashur Perkins get into character for The Pirates of Penzance. Paige Ashby Local Real Estate Cars For Sale 
STUDENTS of the School of Total Education will peform their own musical rendition of the classic title, The Pirates of Penzance. 
Twenty-five secondary students have spent three months preparing and rehearsing to tell the pirates' tale. 
The group of actors met every Wednesday afternoon and spent another four hours on Saturdays rehearsing. 
The crew then spent another two and half days practising during the school holidays. Maddie Williment, Ellie Douglas, Emily Lackner and Caroline Fern play the daughters in The Pirate of Penzance. 
Students said they were feeling nervous but excited to present the production. 
"We're pretty excited, a lot of time and effort has gone into it," Year 12 student Ashur Perkins said. 
"It's my last musical this year so it's a big of a milestone I guess." 
The big show will be held this weekend on both Friday and Saturday night at 7.30pm. 
Tickets are $15 for adults and $10 for concession. 
Phone the school on 46612666 for information. PIRATE PERFORMANCE: SOTE students rehearse for their upcoming musical. entertainment
